# Discord Chat Analysis for ðŸ’»â”‚developers Channel

## 1. Summary
The discussion primarily focused on app communication patterns in Hyperfy. 0mka inquired about accessing AppsList.js data directly from a hyp without knowing instanceIds. Ashxn explained that apps are designed to be isolated for security and simplicity, recommending event-based communication and world storage instead. They discussed the efficiency of event-based communication, with Ashxn assuring that events are as cheap as function calls and widely used in production. 

Other technical topics included questions about potential memory leaks (none currently known), footstep sound implementation for character animations (suggested using collision detection on feet), and animation capabilities for GLB files in v2 (currently limited to GLBs with bones/armatures). There was also a brief discussion about portal functionality and place targeting, with some confusion between v1 and v2 implementation differences.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Can I access AppsList.js Apps Pane stuff in a hyp directly without knowing the instanceIds? (asked by 0mka) A: No, apps can't do that. If two apps want to communicate, use events - this is by design. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Why is direct access to other apps restricted by design? (asked by 0mka) A: For security and simplicity. Objects should exist independently, making the portable app format possible and easier to reason about. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Are there any memory leak concerns with audio/video loops? (asked by 0mka) A: There are zero memory leaks that I'm aware of at the moment. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Has anyone played with adding footstep sounds to the character animations? (asked by Mugenomics) A: Good idea, should be doable but probably won't be 100% in time, only estimated. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Can I animate a scene GLB similar to v1? (asked by emotionull) A: You can only animate GLBs that have bones in v2 for now. (answered by á²¼~/^b0gie-(.*)$/)
Q: Can I add a portal to a specific place of my scene? (asked by carlosmu) A: Unanswered

# Discord Chat Analysis

## 1. Summary
The conversation primarily revolves around collaborative building in Hyperfy worlds and the technical aspects of .hyp files. Community members discuss organizing live building events where people can collectively build while others spectate. They explore ideas like "Builder Royale" competitions and implementing a "Deleter" agent to manage world size and prevent crashes. 

A significant technical discussion focuses on the difference between .hyp and .glb files. Lastraum explains that .hyp files contain scripts that automatically convert Decentraland colliders to Hyperfy colliders, making them more user-friendly. HypPrivakos shares code for implementing drag-and-drop functionality for .hyp files. The community also discusses world size limitations, noting that Doge's entire world is just over 1GB, suggesting practical limits for collaborative building sessions.

Several members mention developing entertainment applications and modular spaces for events like DJ performances, showing ongoing creative development within the community.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Any reason to use hyp instead of just a glb? (asked by HypPrivakos - HyperWorld.Host) A: Hyp files contain scripts that convert Decentraland colliders to Hyperfy colliders automatically, making them more user-friendly without manual manipulation. (answered by Lastraum)
Q: Which hypes have issues? (asked by Lastraum) A: There's an issue with some models created by Decentraland that have external textures causing failures. (answered by Lastraum)
